Job Description: Summary ResponsibilitiesDeputy Executive Director (Finance and Operations) is a top management team member and reports directly to the Executive Director. The deputy executive director in charge of finance and operations works closely with the executive director and other leadership team members to set the organisation's strategic goals. S/he then translates these into specific operational objectives. The candidate assumes a strategic role in the overall financial management of the institute. The Director is primarily responsible for planning, implementing, managing and controlling all the institute's financial and budget-related activities to improve efficiency and reduce costs as needed. This will include direct responsibility for accounting, finance, forecasting, strategic planning, job costing, contract and property management, budget analysis and negotiations, funder relationships and compliance, and institutional financing. S/he provides the Executive Director recommendations and financial information to ensure sound and effective institutional governance, strategic planning and development, and reporting to the Board and CDRI’s partners. Specific roles and responsibilities 1-	Finance/Accounting management & leadership•	Provide leadership in the development of the continuous assessment of short and long-term strategic financial objectives. •	Provide strategic management of the accounting and finance functions by providing timely and accurate analysis of budgets, financial trends and forecasts.•	Manage processes for financial forecasting, budgets and consolidation, and reporting to the senior management, the Board, and partners. •	Provide recommendations strategically enhancing financial performance and securing new resource opportunities.•	Design and implement a strategic and results-oriented approach to the mobilization of significant resources •	Oversee accounting policies, procedures and internal controls•	Implement continuous improvements to ensure the integrity of the Institute’s financial information and reporting•	Oversee financial systems implementations and upgrades using appropriate accounting software and applications.•	Manage the relationship with independent auditors.•	Manage financial relationships and compliance with donors and collaborating partner institutions.•	Identify and manage organisational risks, contracts, and legal requirements and compliances•	Ensure that effective internal controls are in place and ensure compliance with GAAP and applicable laws and regulations for financial and tax reporting.•	Ensure effective hiring, training and retaining of skilled accounting and finance officers •	Manage and advise the whole finance team for smooth finance and accounting roles and responsibilities•	Oversee and implement all the further requirements on the accounting and finance regulations from the government agency2-	Operation (HR/Admin & procurement)•	Evaluate regularly the efficiency of operating procedures according to organisational objectives and apply improvements•	Evaluate overall performance by gathering, analysing and interpreting data and metrics.•	Develop measures, or key performance indicators, to assess how the objectives are achieved. •	Ensure that all activities are monitored, and key performance indicators reported on a regular basis •	Revise and formulate policies and promote their implementation •	Oversee procurement processes and resources allocation  •	Manage relationships/agreements with external partners/vendors•	Ensure that the institute runs with legality and conformity to established regulation
Job Requirement: Required Skills and Qualifications•	At least 10 years of experience in finance and operations, including a minimum of five years in a senior management role, such as director of finance, director of operation, or controller.•	Have a master’s degree/advanced degree in business administration (MBA) and/or a professional accreditation such as certified public accountant (CPA) or certified management accountant (CMA).•	Possess knowledge of all aspects of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).•	Experience managing large project funds from international donors and funders such as World Bank, USAID, UNs, bilateral donors, private companies, and government institutions.•	Strong written and verbal communication. •	Strong analytical, strategic planning, problem-solving and interpersonal skills, including an ability to work well with senior management, staff, and Board members.•	High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of accountability and results orientation.•	Sensitivity to gender and Khmer cultural norms.•	Strong working knowledge of accounting software/applications (QuickBooks, Shape, Sun system, or advanced accounting system management)

Job Description: Profile: Smiling Gecko Cambodia (SGC) was officially registered in 2014 as a local non-profit NGO in Cambodia. It provides direct aid in the form of finance and other support to the needy in Cambodia, sponsoring projects that are sustainable both from an ecological and economic standpoint. We are seeking a Head of Nurse who is responsible for Health Care Department at SGC. S/he will work as The Nurse’s primary responsibility is to provide medical examination and basic medical health care/treatment, first aid, preventive service, and medical emergency relief to SGC staff and families inside farm as well as SGC students and refer patient to appropriate clinic/hospitals to relief suffering from sickness for healthiness and happiness. POSITION	:	Head of NurseJOB TERM	:	Full TimeNº of HIRING	:	1REPORT TO	:	Director Of Operation (DOO)FUNCTION	:	Health Care DepartmentLOCATION	:	Srae Sar village, Tbaeng Khpos, Samakki MeanChey, Kampong ChhnangBENEFIT	:	Accommodation, Food, Insurance, and other attractive benefits. SALARY	:	Competitive JOB RESPONSIBILITIES	·	Administer evidence based first aid to all who present to the Health Clinic; ensure appropriate documentation of events·	Capable of rapidly assessing and responding to emergency situations in an organized and calm manner to ensure optimal response and results·	Supervise and mentor nursing assistants ultimately ensuring competency of medical care provided to the SGC’s community members·	Provide confidential health advice to SGC community members·	Develop/update policies and procedures for the Health Clinic using current policy and evidence-based practices·	Maintain necessary and appropriate communication with the school administration, parents, and students in order to promote and maintain students’ & staff health and welfare·	Liaise with health professionals regarding management of chronic and contagious conditions·	Provides health instruction and training within SGC using sound learning and developmental theories to promote and educate in health and wellness topics·	Ability to work cooperatively in a multicultural setting with students, parents, school personnel, and community agencies·	Participates in professional conferences dealing with education and health within the limits of nursing practice·	Maintain medical concerns list and provide copies to appropriate departments
Job Requirement: JOB REQUIREMENTS·	Graduate of an accredited program of nursing - transcripts required·	Two years public health experience with references; experience with child and adolescent health, school health, or community health - preferred·	Current license to practice as a registered professional nurse in country of origin – preferred·	Strong interpersonal and communication skills·	Good communication in written and spoken English and Khmer language  ·	Computer literacy·	Being sympathetic, care, and willing to relief sickness/suffering from other·	Enjoy and love working with children HOW TO APPLY:-	If you are interested, please submit your CV & Cover Letter with your SALARY EXPECTATION to detail information below: o	The subject of email shall be Application for Head of Nurse o	To: recruitment@smilinggecko-cambodia.orgo	Address: Srae Sar village, Tbaeng Khpos commune, Samakki Meanchey district, Kompong Chhnang province, Cambodia.Note! Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for interview.
Company Profile:
About Smiling Gecko Cambodia:
In 2014, Smiling Gecko Cambodia (SGC) was officially registered as a local NGO in Cambodia. SGC is legally independent of Smiling Gecko Switzerland. Following its mission of «Cambodians help Cambodians», the organization provides direct aid to disadvantaged people in the country, supporting local job initiatives and promoting self-help among the rural population. Apart from providing direct aid and supporting other NGOs, Smiling Gecko, thus, focuses on fighting the causes of poverty and helping people to help themselves. To this end, SGC launched a project on a previously acquired site to the North of Phnom Penh whose objective is to provide several thousand Cambodians with future job training and a regular income in the sectors of agriculture, tourism, industry, and trade. In future, the proceeds are intended to cover the operating costs of the innovative pilot school, which is also part of the cluster and provides education to nearly 1,000 children (from preschool to senior high school).
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department    recruitment@smilinggecko-cambodia.org Kampong Chhnang  Srae Sar village, Tbaeng Khpos commune, Samakki Meanchey district, Kompong Chhnang province, Cambodia.

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

The Sanctuary Spa with treatment rooms in 8 free standing buildings, its own pool and the adjoining Sanctuary Café. Company Profile:
About Smiling Gecko Cambodia:
In 2014, Smiling Gecko Cambodia (SGC) was officially registered as a local NGO in Cambodia. SGC is legally independent of Smiling Gecko Switzerland. Following its mission of «Cambodians help Cambodians», the organization provides direct aid to disadvantaged people in the country, supporting local job initiatives and promoting self-help among the rural population. Apart from providing direct aid and supporting other NGOs, Smiling Gecko, thus, focuses on fighting the causes of poverty and helping people to help themselves. To this end, SGC launched a project on a previously acquired site to the North of Phnom Penh whose objective is to provide several thousand Cambodians with future job training and a regular income in the sectors of agriculture, tourism, industry, and trade. In future, the proceeds are intended to cover the operating costs of the innovative pilot school, which is also part of the cluster and provides education to nearly 1,000 children (from preschool to senior high school).
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department    recruitment@smilinggecko-cambodia.org Kampong Chhnang  Srae Sar village, Tbaeng Khpos commune, Samakki Meanchey district, Kompong Chhnang province, Cambodia.

Job Requirement: • Bachelor’s Degree in Digital Marketing, Marketing, Public Relations or other related field.• Minimum three years in a Marketing, Digital Marketing role driving performance and delivering strong business results. • At least 2-3 years of experience in social media strategy, content creation, or a related field.• In-depth understanding of social media platforms, their respective algorithm changes, and best practices for content creation.• A passion for social media, digital marketing, and staying ahead in the ever-evolving social media landscape.• Hands-on experience with SEO, Google Analytics, CRM software and other similar marketing tools/platforms• Experience in videography, photography, and design/editing skills in Adobe Suite or equivalent • Ability to communicate in written and spoken Khmer & English to an exceptional standard with a keen eye for detail and accuracy. • This position is based in Phnom Penh.Skills & Abilities:• Excellent analytical skills, problem-solving skills, and ability to interpret data to make informed decisions• Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.• A strong portfolio showcasing previous social media management work.• The ability to work autonomously, manage tasks independently, and learn quickly.• A result-oriented mindset with a strong focus on conversions, goals, funnels, sales and results.• The ability to manage and prioritize your time effectively to produce consistent and high-quality content.
Company Profile:
Created with sustainability in mind, Song Saa Private Island reflects the beauty of the Cambodian coastline. It’s a place that breathes in time with nature, built from local materials, by local hands, and infused with local art and soul. An evolved tropical getaway with a pristine private beach, spacious wooden villas, heavenly spa sanctuaries and a preserved coral reef, Song Saa Private Island lets you detach from the world and tune into simple luxuries.

Built with reclaimed timber and materials from the mainland, the resort’s design and architecture reiterates our commitment to sustainability. Each villa is a private sanctuary, a refined blend of thatched roofs, linen-draped canopy beds, up-cycled décor and repurposed furniture. Discarded oil drums find new life as lamps. Driftwood serves as a table or bench. Salvaged wood from old fishing boats and factory yards now forms decks and floors and beams.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078330733 talent@songsaa.com Koh Ouen, Khan Mittapheap, Preah Sihanouk 078330733

We welcome dynamic, purpose driven individuals who desire to make an impact and leave an impression in the best environment of success to join our team.

Job Description: Job Announcement𝐙𝐀𝐍𝐃𝐎 𝐂𝐨., 𝐋𝐭𝐝., the parent company of 𝐙𝐀𝐍𝐃𝐎, 𝐓𝐄𝐍𝟏𝟏, 𝐆𝐀𝐓𝐎𝐍𝐈, 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐞, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝟑𝟔𝟏° planning to extend across the country, is currently looking for a talented and potential candidate in the position of Senior Fashion Merchandiser.Job Title: Senior Fashion MerchandiserCategory: Fashion, Merchandising, PurchasingJob Summary: Planning and developing merchandising strategies. Analyzing sales figures, customers' reactions, and market trends to anticipate product needs and collaborating with designers, operations, warehouses, and suppliers to negotiate prices, quantities, and time scales.Merchandisers are not fashion designers. He/she stays close to the fashion world and uses their fashion sense and analytical mind to determine how much of each style to purchase and stock, negotiate with manufacturers, and suppliers, and work with fashion designers to determine emerging or existing trends. Job Description:•	Keep up with the latest Fashion trend and communicate regularly with fashion designers in order to blend fashion sense with quantitative analysis by looking at how products have performed in the past and forecast consumer demands for upcoming seasons.•	Use fashion knowledge and trend analysis to decide how to purchase and stock a retail store. Decide which new styles to order, which items to reorder, the quantity of each item, and colors and sizes to stock.•	Purchase and negotiate with manufacturers and designers to make sure items can be priced in a way that will sell and make a profit.•	Determine how each store should be stocked based on store sales performance, different customer demographics, and store environment.•	Prepare budget planning for monthly stock purchases for the upcoming season, and present it to management for approval.•	Schedule timeline from production, to finish product and delivery to ensure on-time for the season.•	Other tasks assigned by Merchandising Manager.
Job Requirement: Requirements:•	BA/BS degree in Fashion Design or related field•	3-year+ experience in a product management role•	A strong ability in forecasting, analytical, negotiation, and communication skill•	Understand fashion trend and their demand•	English: usable for medium-professional setting•	Proficient in MS Office and Adobe Suites •	Ability to work independently•	Strong attention to detail*𝐎𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫 𝐛𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐟𝐢𝐭𝐬:• Annual Bonus• Employee Discount• Birthday Package• Other benefitsInterested candidates are invited to submit their updated CV, and cover letter to our email: hr@zandokh.com or 𝙏𝙀𝙇𝙀𝙂𝙍𝘼𝙈: 𝟎𝟖𝟏 𝟐𝟕 𝟓𝟑 𝟓𝟑Join us on Telegram for more job opportunities: https://t.me/zandocareer

Job Description: ZANDO Co., Ltd., founded in early 2015, one of Cambodia's leading fashion retail companies and the parent company of ZANDO, TEN11, GATONI, ROUTINE, and 361° planning to extend across the country with more upcoming brands, is currently looking for Cooperate Sales Executive.Job Description: •	Actively seek out new and maintain existing sales opportunities through cold calling, networking, and social media •	Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services•	Report financial sales data to Merchandising Manager•	Ensure the availability of stock for sales and demonstrations•	Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions, conferences, or networking events•	Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections•	After settling the agreement, prepare sales contracts and submit orders for processing•	Provide information, quotes, credit terms, and other bid specifications to clients•	Negotiate prices, terms of sales, and/or service agreements; prepare contracts and submit orders•	Collaborate with purchasing departments, managers, and other staff to confirm that orders are processed with accuracy and efficiency and that products are distributed properly•	Answer after-sale service with inquiries from clients concerning their products•	Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share it with internal teams•	Perform other duties as assigned.
Job Requirement: Job Requirements:•	Bachelor's degrees in sales and marketing, and telemarketing•	Proven experience in corporate sales as a result-driven individual •	Excellent knowledge of MS Office•	Hands-on experience with CRM software is a plus•	Thorough understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques•	Fast learner and passion for sales•	Self-motivated with a results-driven approach*Benefits:•	Annual Bonus•	Employee Discount•	All leaves complied with the labor law•	NSSF and Seniority•	Birthday Package•	Other benefitsInterested candidates are invited to submit their updated CV, cover letter & portfolio to our email: hr@zandokh.com or 𝙏𝙀𝙇𝙀𝙂𝙍𝘼𝙈: 𝟎𝟖𝟏 𝟐𝟕 𝟓𝟑 𝟓𝟑 ( https://t.me/zandocareers )

Job Description: I.	Job SummaryOperations Manager is a key part of a Management Team and oversees a high level of business operations and the respective department. They also analyze and improve organizational processes, quality, productivity, and efficiency. Working in close collaboration to plan, organize, and coordinate work activities of respective heads of department and teams relating to Accounting and Finance, Land Asset Management, HR&Admin, and Legal perspective. II.	Duties & ResponsibilitiesOperation •	Develop, implement, and review operational policies & procedures and SOPs. •	Develops annual operating budgets and monitors operational expenses on a regular basis and implements strategies to ensure operational costs are kept to a minimum.•	Provide support and follow up on various tasks and special projects as assigned by Chairman/CEO•	Manage day-to-day operations in accordance with company policies and standards and prepare operational reports for Chairman/CEO•	Make important policy, planning, and strategy decisions.•	Help promote a company culture that encourages top performance and high morale.•	Identify and address problems and opportunities for the company.•	Implement necessary checks and balance to mitigate operational risks across all departments and to ensure the best interest of the company.•	Work effectively and provide support to HODs in term of inter-department communications and co-dependency to achieve the company vision, mission, and goal. •	Liaison with top management team and assist in the development of operational activities of each respective department. •	Working directly with Chairman/CEO in planning and executing the company’s strategies.Financial support •	Oversee monthly and quarterly assessments and forecasts of the company’s financial performance against budget, financial and operational goals.•	Improve the overall financial management, planning, systems, and controls of reporting.•	Review financial statements and data. Utilize financial ratios and analytics to improve profitability. Co-ordinate and control operational budgets. •	Plan effective strategies for the financial health of the company.Land support •	Liaison with Land Dept to create and improve processes, checklists, and reporting systems within the Real Estate Division to improve operational efficiency.•	Assist Land Dept with prioritizing, strategizing, and keeping focused on key tasks and projects.•	Work with Land Acquisition Management team to prepare portfolio and asset-level reporting.Legal support •	Work with the legal department to resolve on-going legal matters.•	Ensure all legal and regulatory documents are filed and monitor compliance with laws and regulations.•	Liaison with top management. Assist in the development of strategic plans for operational activity. Implement and manage operational plans.•	Pro-actively strive to have an in-depth understanding and keep abreast of the new laws and regulations of the local and international property market and being aware of the current legal issues of the country specifically pertaining to the property law.HR support •	Liaison with HR Department to overlook HR Operations Administrative Tasks, oversee and refine employee standards and procedure, maintain, and enhance employee benefits programs, •	Assist with recruitment efforts.•	Identify and recommend improvements to internal standard operating procedures, including team restructuring and morale building.
Job Requirement: •	Bachelor’s degree specializing in a property related or equivalent experience preferred.•	Excellent knowledge with rules and regulations of real estate industry in Cambodia •	Proven ability to be flexible, prioritize and manage multiple projects, as well as solve problems in a timely manner.•	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role within property industry•	Superior managerial and diplomacy skills.•	Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.•	Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.•	Hardworking, shows initiative, ability to multi-task.•	honest, friendly, flexible, committed, and positive attitude.•	Computer literacy Word, Excel, PowerPoint. •	Critical Thinking Skills•	Strong Team Player, with a proactive attitude •	Good Listening & Observation Skills
Contact Info: Contact Information HR & Admin Department HR Manager 093777890 careers@khunseagroup.com Phnom Penh #217, St. 369, Daeum Meakkloea, Sangkat Chhbar Ampov Ti Muoy, Khan Chbar Ampov, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 093777890

job title: Academic Coordinator ($3K-$4K) St. H.E. Chea Sophara
position: Academic Coordinator ($3K-$4K) St. H.E. Chea Sophara
Job Description: •	Set yearly school goals to support the school’s Strategic Plan and lead the Academic Department to achieve the set goal in accordance with school vision, mission and SLOs;•	Report monthly achievement to the campus manager, school director, and BOD;•	Propose action plan for next month and assist the campus manager/school director in setting school goals and directions of the campus;•	Represent school in the community/media and participate in the school marketing activities, fundraising events, celebrations, or other activities to promote school reputation and public awareness;•	Ensure the academic and student records are in compliance with the requirements from Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport; •	Plan and implement a system to evaluate the success of the international curriculum and the effectiveness of the teaching based on data of student learning outcomes from internal assessments and external assessment;•	Lead and support Khmer teachers in their work duties including reviewing lesson plans, improving teaching standards/approach and providing training and professional development plan in the Khmer Program;•	Lead and support the Academic Team in their work duties, including collecting/reviewing data on student grades, progress, learning approach, behavior, attendance, and proposing action plan for improvement with relevant faculty members/managers; •	Review school policies and procedures regularly to ensure the effective operation of the school, and create ad hoc committees to propose improvements to policies and procedures;•	Conduct performance review of staff in the Academic Department and Khmer Faculty and provide reflective feedback and support staff to achieve the set professional growth; •	Create positive school climate and culture of thriving for excellence within the whole school; •	Develop professional development plans or training for the Academic Team and Khmer Teachers; •	Organize promotional events for school to the public, in the media or session for parent or public;•	Task staff members to organize sessions to cultivate student culture of growth mindset, desire to learn, and independent learners in accordance with the character profile adopted school wide; •	Task staff members to organize academic competitions and lead students in various educational events/competitions outside of school; •	Liaise with third parties to create partnership, improve school programs, and exchange good practices and friendship; •	Meet with parents to discuss about student academic as well as other concerns; •	Attend and conduct educational trainings and conferences as needed; •	Attend and conduct academic meetings with relevant staff members and teachers;•	Perform other managerial tasks in accordance with the campus management.
Job Requirement: •	Hold Bachelor’s degree/ Master Degree of Education or TESOL, or related field;•	Minimum of 1-year experience in education field is preferred;•	Experience in international school is a plus;•	Experience in managing a team is a plus;•	Excellent written and oral communication skills in English;•	Ability to work well under tight deadlines and deliver effective result;•	Desire to learn and overcome new challenges;•	Hard working and self-motivated person, honest, reliable, loyal, responsible, and very good team work;•	Willing to work with diversified international team.  •       Working Location : St. H.E. Chea Sophara •       Salary rank : $3000-$400•       Working Days : Mon - Fri•       W0rking hour : 8am-5pm
Contact Info: Contact Information Belly (Mr.)  HR Manager 069222004 hrecruitment88@gmail.com Phnom Penh 1st Floor of Altos Hotel, St.148 Corner St.19, Sangkat Phsar Kandal II, Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 069222004

job title: បុគ្គលិកបើកបរ (Driver)
position: បុគ្គលិកបើកបរ (Driver)
Job Description:
	បើកបររថយន្តជូនបុគ្គលិកសម្រាប់ប្រតិបត្តិការរបស់ការិយាល័យកណ្តាល។
	ថែទាំ និង ជួសជុលរថយន្តជារៀងរាល់ថ្ងៃ ដើម្បីឲ្យប្រាកដថា ខ្លួនពិតជាបានត្រួតពិនិត្យមើលប្រេង ទឹក        អាគុយ ហ្រ្វាំង កង់ ជាដើម។
	ធានាថារថយន្តត្រូវបានសម្អាត និងថែទាំបចេ្ចកទេសបានត្រឹមត្រូវ។
	សហការជាបុគ្គលិកនៅផ្នែកផ្សេងៗទៀត ដើម្បីឲ្យធ្វើឲ្យមានទំនាក់ទំនងល្អក្នុងការងារ។
	ជួយការងាររបស់អ្នកបើកបរដទៃទៀត ក្នុងករណីចំបាច់ និង បំពេញការងារផ្សេងៗ។
	ការងារផ្សេងទៀតក្រោមការចាត់ចែងរបស់អ្នកគ្រប់គ្រង។
Job Requirement:
 កម្រិតសិក្សាចាប់ពីថ្នាក់ទី១២ឡើងទៅ។
 មានបទពិសោធន៍បើកបរយ៉ាងតិច ២ឆ្នាំ។
 យល់ដឹងពីច្បាប់ចរាចរណ៍និងបទបញ្ជាផ្សេងៗនៃ ចរាចរណ៍ផ្លូវគោក និងចេះដោះស្រាយបញ្ហាព្រមទាំងជួល។ជុលរថយន្តពេលដែលខូចរឺក៏មានបញ្ហានៅតាមផ្លូវ
 អាចទៅធ្វើការនៅតាមខេត្តតាមការចាត់តាំងរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន
 មានប័ណ្ណបើកបរត្រឹមត្រូវ និងមានសុពលភាព។
Company Profile: LOLC (CAMBODIA) PLC. is one of the top licensed microfinance institutions in Cambodia with a social vision and a business orientation that provides entrepreneurs and families at the base of the socio-economic pyramid with economic opportunities to transform the quality of their lives and their communities through the provision of effective and sustainable client-empowering financial services. Job Description:
- Answer customer’s inquiries related to LOLC products and services.
- Maintain close relationship with all walk-ins either customer or management and staff.
- Handle customer issues and complaint (on phone, face-to-face and email).
- Receive feedback and suggestion from customer as well as escalate to supervisor for further action.
- Identify customer’s needs to drive the best solution to meet customer’s expectation and
satisfaction.
- Follow up with concern departments and/or branches to make sure all complaints are resolved on
time.
- Conduct out-going calls survey and SMS broadcast to customer for Marketing campaign/promotion.
- Perform other tasks as assigned by manager.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor Degree in marketing, business administration, management, public relation or equivalent.
- At least 1 year experience in customer service, receptionist, and call center or help desk capacity
required.
- Good English.

Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.
